movieReview: Still liked this flick, but perhaps 3 times in 7 months is a bit much (the family wanted to watch it)
Lol horrible
Really thought-provoking...  Believe me when I say I've thought quite a bit about AI, but this movie caused me to consider new angles I had never before.
Good, but mostly because of how amazing the true story is.  Hanks does a great job and makes up for some pretty average filmmaking.
It was OK, parts of it were moving and other parts just felt too produced.
Quite good, a haunting story inspired by terrible real-life events
Quite good, great performances and an engaging story...
Pretty good!  First horror movie I’ve seen in ages that wasn’t found footage and/or ghost bullshit.
Still awesome.  I love this movie.
Really good, maybe spent a bit too much time on Judith Hill...
A dramatization of the creation and early years of Doctor Who.  Quite enjoyable, at least for this Who fan.
movieTitle: An Adventure in Space and Time

movieReview: Really great performances but never quite came together for me.
I love Maron's brand of neurosis....
Mat owns and this was a pretty good summary of his achievements.
movieTitle: Mat Hoffman: The Birth of Big Air

movieReview: Did a reasonable job of adding a touch of humanity to the robot romney.
Liked it mostly but the ending was fucking annoying.
Lots of fun, a nice 80m pretty 'serious' take on Dracula.
Watched this after reading the book for the first time.  Such a great movie, just the right amount of stuff edited out of the book to make it amazing.
I liked this movie but it had it's issues.  Quasi Comedy of Errors...  Some of the plot seemed a little too contrived..  But still a fun watch..
A fairly stripped down version of the novel..  Mildly entertaining, but probably better left as a book.
Still fantastic.  I'm seeing the remake this Sunday, I'm guessing it won't be so fantastic.
A very different take from the original.  Almost no satire, instead psychological/body-horror.  I enjoyed it alot.  Not as good as the original, but still good on it's own.
Fine, but not as good as Manhunter and very forced.
Really great doc about an obsessive tinkerer...
Watched this again with Corinna (who hadn't seen it).  Still good, wish the plot of the 3rd movie started more in this movie.
Great 30-for-30 doc covering the Tonya Harding/Nancy Kerrigan fiasco.  Some really great momenets where Tonya is clearly in denial...
Very meh.
I had never seen this movie, it was really good...  Some Hollywood "inside baseball" but in a way most could enjoy...
Always interesting to see the crazy deniers in full flourish...
This was a beautiful film.  I don't think I know what was going on.

For some reason I've always been fascinated by Bob Forrest, Rock Frontman turned Addiction Recovery consultant..  I read about this documentary years ago but was reminded of it through some wikipedia rabbithole...  Like a well-made, less gimmicky Behind the Music.
Fucked up but enjoyable...  Better than the premise would indicate.
Ok, but could have been better.  I prefer more science, less pop in my pop-science.
Good doc on the creative process and some of the difficulties of comic strip artists.
A pretty good movie, more of a thriller than your normal Comic Book movie.  Way better than the 1st.
Less meh than the first but still pretty meh.
I love stories about failed attempts at epic art.  I love Jodorowsky.  This movie was perfect for me.
Still amazingly great.

Had very good moments but never quite gelled for me.  Was really distracted by the extreme closeups and handheld camera (which normally doesn't bother me).  I had a lot of trouble keeping the characters straight.
IN COUNTRY is about something I didn’t know existed: Vietnam War reenactors. Good doc; I wish some broader context was provided
OVERNIGHTERS is a good doc about a gas boom town in ND with a housing deficit and the pastor trying to help the influx of people
was an OK road trip movie, but I felt like I had seen all of its components before
The male & female leads were really good, but the antagonists were over the top & telegraphed, and it was lacking plot
a beautiful doc about a painter finding a way to continue to improve his art while dealing with ALS
a good doc about the lawsuit that ended Prop 8 in CA. Bonus was the Q&A featuring two of the defendants.
a surprisingly engaging look at the history of General Tso's Chicken starting with the man himself
is about preachers who also fight MMA. It chose its subjects wisely and seemed to treat them pretty fairly.
a quasi-biodoc of Nick Cave reflecting on his life. I liked it, but it's weirdness might not work for some
had some wonderful stories and was a great directorial debut for Mike Myers.
movieTitle: Supermensch: The Legend of Shep Gordon

movieReview: a doc about a fascinating subject I knew nothing about, so I was very engaged despite it being poorly edited.
features two really hate-able characters, and while that device usually doesn't work for me it was really funny here.
a good profile of NJ's own City Gardens and the man who booked it, Randy Now. Tons of great interviews
My favorite movie of the festival so far.  Definitely see it.
Ok.
Enjoyed this alot even though I haven't seen the original film.
Inspirations for this film ended up being VERY distracting.  Terry Gilliam's FIGHT CLUB with Wes Anderson as Second-Unit Director and Sound Design by David Lynch.  Meh.

This film was wonderful.  Such a contrast from THE DOUBLE which I saw the night before.  Both clearly inspired by Gilliam, but while THE DOUBLE felt like a retread, MOOD INDIGO felt completely original.
Really good thriller....  "Only the one?"
Homage to 80s horror suspense movies, but it sure did feel like it took a long time to get where it was going.
Great look into the banality of vampirism...  A drama who's characters happen to be vampires...
Still great, maybe even better the second time around
Jodorowsky is so wonderfully weird.
This seemed a bit goofier the second time around but it's still fun.
This sounded goofier than it was...  I had a hard time understanding how much time was passing, and the child-like speech of the android was off-putting at times, but not bad at all...
Still awesome as ever.
Even Awesomer.
Too long, bad acting and dialogue.  Could have been good with a more talented director.
movieTitle: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones

movieReview: Kind of ok, I hope the series is better.
Good, but I think I liked "First Class" better.  Or maybe I'm just getting bored of the X-Men universe.
Jodorowsky can still turn it out.  Less weird than I expected while still being terribly weird.  If Santa Sangre was about mommy issues, this movie is about daddy issues.
Dumb fun summer action movie....  Don't scratch too much or it might hurt.
I'm always fascinated by obscure Disney history...  This was no exception, though it wasn't punch-my-dick-off fascinating.
movieTitle: The Bubble: A Documentary Film About Celebration, Florida

movieReview: Still amusing but not as funny as I remembered from being a kid...  Amazing how DUI was A-OK in this movie...  Played for comedy, even.
Not good.  The setting on the plane made all of the action scenes seem the same.  Plot was ridiculously complicated;  Bond villain esque...
Really good. By far the best abortion comedy ever made.
Still great, though the Sarah Connor voiceovers (not including the intro) are pretty corny.
Toooooo looooooong.
Still awesome.  The "Don't Stop Me Now" sequence is one of my favorites of all time.

A great look at a wonderful filmmaker...  Interesting choice to not identify the interview subjects with a overlay... Either that or the iTunes copy of it is defective...  I recognized most of the subjects, but there are some that I still have no idea who they are..  Not that it really matters...
movieTitle: Stanley Kubrick: A Life in Pictures

movieReview: This was a very slow paced movie but quite good.  And at 80 minutes it was short, if not slow.
Ok, not my favorite Wes Anderson, but pleasant.
Fascinating look at a evangelical preacher who doesn't believe.
A perfectly fine summer coming-of-age movie.
A very sad story, but could have benefitted if 15 minutes or so were trimmed...  Also it was really annoying that the narrator changed pronounciations of "Swartz" randomly throughout the movie...
movieTitle: The Internet's Own Boy: The Story of Aaron Swartz

movieReview: Still a really fun movie...
Pretty generic, as I expected...  Plot was full of holes, but kept me just engaged just long enough to not be considered a bad movie.  Decent cable sick day flick.
Entertaining, though I had already listened to the radio version of this live show, so some of the laughs and surprises were missing...
movieTitle: This American Life Live!  The Invisible Made Visible

movieReview: Probably a bit oversold on me...  Really enjoyable the first hour, sagged in the second but still remained enjoyable...
Pretty enjoyable, though don't scratch at it too much...  Special Effects were amazing.
movieTitle: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes

movieReview: Good for a kids movie.  Not as great as everyone led me to believe it was.

Better than I expected...  Decently balanced humor with seriousness...  George Clooney has one of the worst 'running' performances in cinema history.  Seriously, he was the opposite of Tom Cruise running.

I did not really like this movie.  But it also didn't make me want to murder anyone.  I really hated Darren Aronofsky's first few films, but the last 2-3 have changed my mind on him...  But this was not a good movie.

Not sure how you make a movie about the life and music of James Brown kinda boring, but they did.  Chadwick Bozeman was awesome, but there was something lifeless about the music scenes.  I expected to be dancing in my seat and I totally wasn't.
Better than the (awful) second, but still not that great.  A pale shadow of the first...

I thought OLYMPUS HAS FALLEN was WHITE HOUSE DIE HARD, but it turns out that title belongs to this movie.  Don't get me wrong, it's nowhere near as good as DIE HARD, but so much of the plot and beats are lifted directly from it...
Still amazing.  I forgot how many people are in this movie.  The list of name actors who are NOT in the movie is probably shorter.

I loved The Guard, but this movie (from the same actor/director team) let me down...  It's very depressing, but beyond that, I didn't feel like it communicated any actual ideas.  All of the characters were more like caricatures/archetypes without any real depth.
First time seeing the greatest action movie of all time on the big screen.  It was awesome.
A real piece of shit.
I liked this movie...  It wasn't great, but it was a really fun side of band life that I'm not sure has been explored before...
Still riveting and unbelievable.  Such a wonderful doc...

Believe it or not, I had never seen this movie...  The whole premise always struck me as goofy, and to be honest, it was...   Despite all of the baseball, and Fenway and Liotta, I still didn't really like this movie...
Fascinating!
movieTitle: Resurrect Dead: The Mystery of the Toynbee Tiles

movieReview: Funny, fun, engaging, relatively short (2 hours) and well written.  Not my favorite Marvel movie but quite enjoyable.
Still a good movie..  I like that it took more of a "Thriller" than "Action" tack.
Probably not as good as the book but still a good movie..
Still so awesome, and to see it on the big screen for the first time since it came out was also special...
Meh.  I enjoyed the live-action first half, but the animation was really goofy looking and the entire film seemed to have a message to express but really failed to do so.
Still a pretty good movie...
Like a slice of fried gold.
OK, but had lots of little bits that pissed me off....  Tom Hardy was great as usual.
A very tropey adventure/disaster movie....  Not horrible but not good.
Statham in a kind of meandery good guy turned bad guy turned slightly more good guy flick...
Not great but has it's moments, watched it with Corinna forgetting that the parts of Jackass she likes the least are the pranks involving civilians...  So that might not have been the best choice.
Less ass kicking than I expect from a modern Liam Neeson movie, but still enjoyable.
Way better than I expected, people had kinda shat all over this movie but I liked it quite a bit.
Pretty creepy, and for the love of christ, thankfully NOT FOUND FOOTAGE.
So infrequent i'm caught off-guard and surprised by a movie these days, but this one did it.  Fincher is a master.

Finally got to see this flick after it was pulled from IFFBoston at the last minute many years ago...  I have no idea what held it up all these years, but it's an interesting look behind the scenes of a week at SNL.
I'm forever fascinated and sympathetic with the benign anarchist.
A great profile of an completely unique artist.
Watched this based on the rec of a friend, it was good, but your typical tv talking head/interview pop-culture history documentary...
movieTitle: Going to Pieces: The Rise and Fall of the Slasher Film

movieReview: Maybe my favorite movie of the year.  Several great performances, a compelling story, and gorgeous visuals...  I'm sure it WASN'T one long take, but it certainly felt that way.
movieTitle: Birdman (or The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)

movieReview: I randomly found this doc when the TV was tuned to Showtime when I turned on the TV. It was a nice documentary covering the history of the band..
Another of my long list of Kickstarter films..  A good look at the troubles and people running television shows.
movieTitle: Showrunners: The Art of Running a TV Show

movieReview: Only OK...  Had some good gags, but nowhere near as funny as the first...
Really, really good.  Gorgeous, engaging and interesting.
Completely gripping.  So tense and well acted...
Funner than it sounds, and an interesting look at the end of an industry
Still pretty good, I think it was better with a crowd.
Armstrong is fascinating...   The hubris is awesome.
Very engaging even though I pretty much knew everything about this story.  My favorite superhero movie of the year.
Still fucking awesome.
Horrible.  Racist, misogynist and straight-up boring at times.
movieTitle: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom

movieReview: Dad was introducing the kids to this movie, and I have to say it holds up pretty well.  Watching it 3 days in a row, however, was not so awesome.
The 25th Anniversary Bluray looks fantastic and this movie is still really funny
I hadn't seen this movie since it was new, and it was funnier than I remembered...
A chronology of Banksy's month-long residence in NYC.  Covered each day's pieces/installations and some of the hubbub and controversy they caused.
Pretty hokey...  While less racist and misogynist than Temple of Doom, still pretty bad.  I guess it turns out that the only good Indiana Jones movie is the original.
movieTitle: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

movieReview: I dunno how 'real' it was, but it did make Pauly Shore seem like an OK guy...    It's interesting to see someone who was pretty big playing tiny midwestern towns in unusual venues....
Good, but stretched.  I would have prefered one 3 hour movie than 2 stretched 2 hour movies to end this series...
Creepy as hell, not super scary though...
Really funny...  Checked him out after seeing him on Seinfeld's interview show..  I was aware he existed (mostly from Breaking Bad) but had no idea he was this funny.
movieTitle: Bill Burr: I'm Sorry You Feel That Way

movieReview: OK, not entirely my thing but definitely had funny moments.
Gorgeous and weird.  I don't actually know what I think of it, yet..
Depressing, but decent.
OK, but the parts I was less interested in were too long and the parts I was interested in was too short...
Way more fun than you'd probably expect...  Less SyFy than you'd expect...
Interesting profile of a strange man.
This was really bad.
Did our patriotic duty watching this movie.  Pretty funny, though it will get more attention than it deserves due to the controversy surrounding it's release.
The greatest action AND the greatest Christmas movie of all time.  Still delivers.
Such a classic.
I wasn't really planning on watching this again so quickly, but Scott got it for Christmas and everyone seemed interested in watching it so I joined in.
I decided I'm going to go thru all of the James Bond movies.  I had thought I had seen most of them, but today I learned I hadn't even seen the first one!  So this should be a bit of an adventure.
Pretty meh.  How about instead of autotuning all of the singing you just hire actors which can sing.
Yet another Bond movie I hadn't seen...  I liked this movie, though I wonder how witnessing the birth of so many Bond tropes would have been thru virgin eyes...

I am starting to believe that I had never seen any of the Sean Connery Bond films.  This is the 3rd one and I definitely hadn't seen it before (tho I had definitely seen a few parts of it here or there).  Very enjoyable, though the judo/fight scenes were laughable..
